opinion.posture:
IN PROHIBITION.
The F.J. Heer Printing Company, relator herein, claims to have been awarded a contract for the printing of material for the General Assembly during the next biennium. Another bidder, The Columbus Blank Book Company, brought an action in the Common Pleas Court against the Director of Finance and the State Purchasing Agent, seeking to have the claimed Heer company contract declared illegal and to compel the defendants to enter into a contract with the plaintiff (Columbus Blank Book Company) for this printing. The Heer company was not made a party to that suit, but an attorney representing it was present throughout the trial and defended the action as attorney for the defendants therein.
The court found that the action of the defendants in attempting to award the contract to the Heer company was illegal, void and of no effect, enjoined defendants from proceeding under the terms of the claimed contract, and directed defendants to award the contract to the blank book company.
The instant action in prohibition was instituted in this court by the Heer company against the judges of the Common Pleas Court and the clerk thereof, seeking a writ prohibiting them from signing, approving or filing a final order or judgment in the Common Pleas Court case, above referred to, and from taking any further action therein.
opinion.attorneys:
Messrs. Powers, Griffith, Jones Bell, for relator.
Mr. Earl Allison, prosecuting attorney, Mr. John M. Vorys andMr. John C. Elam, for respondents.
opinion.opinion_text:
This case has been submitted on the motion of The Columbus Blank Book Company for leave to intervene, and on the motion of the respondents to dismiss the case.Page 120
The motion for leave to intervene is sustained.
The relator being afforded an adequate remedy in the ordinary course of the law, the motion to dismiss the case is sustained.
Case dismissed.
WEYGANDT, C.J., ZIMMERMAN, TAFT, MATTHIAS, RADCLIFF, O'NEILL and GRIFFITH, JJ., concur.
RADCLIFF, J., of the Fourth Appellate District, sitting by designation in the place and stead of HERBERT, J.
